title: #001 Memories
article: The song pays homage to the memories of a loved one who has since passed.

title: #002 Land of the Riding Sun
article: A song made by the wonderful community of Polandball, a modified version of the 60's song "House Of The Rising Sun".

title: #003 Goodbye to Gravity
article: A song made by the wonderful community of Polandball about the Space Race between the USA and USSR, also a parody of "Defying Gravity"

title: #004 Two days into Beligum
article: A song made by the wonderful community of Polandball about World War One.

title: #005 Red Commie Club
article: A song made by the wonderful community of Polandball about a parallel universe of Poland actually liked the USSR.

title: #006 Cupid
article: A a K-pop, disco-pop, synth-pop, and bubblegum song about a young girl's unrequited love and the shame she feels because of it.

title: #007 Turkish March
article:
Mozart's Turkish March, formally known as Rondo alla Turca, is the lively third movement of his Piano Sonata No. 11 in A major, composed in 1783.
This piece captures the essence of Turkish military music, characterized by its catchy melody and rhythmic drive, reflecting the 18th-century fascination with Ottoman culture.
The composition features distinctive percussion elements, such as cymbals and bass drums, evoking the sounds of Turkish Janissary bands, making it one of Mozart's most recognizable works today.

title: #008 Memory
article: Memory is a poignant ballad from the musical Cats, sung by the character Grizabella as she reflects on her lost past and seeks acceptance from others.

title: #009 Do you hear the people sing?
article:
The song is a revolutionary call for people to overcome adversity.
The "barricades" referred to in the song are erected by the rebel students in the streets of Paris in the musical's second act.
They are to draw the National Guard into combat and ignite a civilian uprising to overthrow the government, but their rebellion eventually fails.
In the finale, the song transitions into a solemn hymn in which a world full of peace, freedom, and liberation is anticipated for all mankind.

title: #010 Hooked on Baroque
article:
Hooked on Baroque is a classical crossover album that creatively blends famous Baroque compositions with contemporary rhythms and arrangements.
The exact release date is not known.

title: #011 God Save the King
article: The National Anthum for the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, adopted on September 1745.

title: #012 Star Spangled Banner
article: "The Star-Spangled Banner" is the national anthem of the United States of America.

title: #013 O Canada
article:
"O Canada" (French: Ô Canada) is the national anthem of Canada.
Calixa Lavallée composed the music.
Robert Stanley Weir's 1908 version eventually served as the basis for the official lyrics enacted by Parliament.

title: #014 We Will All Go Together When We Go
pic: 014_We Will All Go Together When We Go.jpg
mp3: 014_We Will All Go Together When We Go.mp3
article:
Tom Lehrer's song "We Will All Go Together When We Go" is a darkly humorous exploration of death and mortality, emphasizing the idea that death is a universal experience that unites all people.
Through clever wordplay and satirical lyrics, Lehrer reflects on the inevitability of collective demise, providing a comical yet thought-provoking perspective on a typically somber subject.
